member_organisations:
DNI is a  CSO and non-profit Organisation. 
 
Currently, the DNI has 337 members from 52 countries: http://www.desertnet-international.org/member_dni_list.php  
 
The DNI Steering Committee has 13 members (http://www.desertnet-international.org/steeringcomm_dni.php).  The DNI Advisory Board has 10 members (http://www.desertnet-international.org/advisoryboard_dni.php).
head_office_address: Biocentre Klein Flottbek and Botanical Garden University of Hamburg Ohnhorststr. 18
eu_initiatives: DesertNet International is member of the SINO-EU PANEL ON LAND AND SOIL
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: As a non-profit organisation the DNI is accredited as CSO to the UNCCD, UNFCCC and to IPBES. As a scientific network it has members in THE SINO-EU PANEL ON LAND AND SOIL. DNI has developed a consortium with WOCAT (www.wocat.net) and GNDRI (www.gndri.net). Its accreditation with IPCC is ongoing.
goals__remit: DesertNet International is a platform for scientific discussions and exchange of ideas. The platform fosters cutting edge science, identifies topics and research areas. DNI analyses the scientific state of the art of the main topics in desertification assessment, risk evaluation, mitigation and restoration. It articulates the economic drivers and the socio-economic consequences of desertification, and integrates scientific findings across disciplines, translate into common language and communicate scientific findings.
relevant_communication: DesertNet International (DNI) collaborates closely with the UNCCD and its Science-Policy Interface (SPI). DNI publishes 4 newsletters per year on sustainable land Management, land Degradation and desertification. The list of publications of ist members can be found online at:http://www.desertnet-international.org/publications_dni.php
position: Member of the THE SINO-EU PANEL ON LAND AND SOIL
